title: The Riot Merchandising Store Beta is LIVE and it ships to OCEANIA!!!
body:
[UPDATE 2]

> Here the link to access the merch store: https://oce.merch.riotgames.com/en/

[UPDATE 1]

> "TL:DR The [merch store is LIVE ](https://oce.merch.riotgames.com/en/)and it ships to Oceania. Spend more than $50 (all prices on the Oceanic page will be in AUD) on merch and enjoy the reduced shipping rate of $10
> Keep in mind, all of that beautiful water around us makes shipping anything to Oceanic countries difficult. The cost of shipping will be $29 per delivery to anywhere in Australia or New Zealand. BUT, if you spend over $50 on merch you will save $19 on shipping, bringing the cost down to $10.
> The discount will be applied automatically but won't be displayed in your cart until the very last stage of checkout. Check out the screen shot below:"




Hi Everyone!

We've all been looking forward to getting our hands on some sweet merchandise, and the wait will soon be over with the Riot Games Merch store Beta soon to launch!! 

Below you'll find an FAQ which should answer most questions. Have a read and if there's any additional questions ask away!

1.	**Why is Riot building a merch store?**
We love League and realize that creating a store full of high-quality items that resonate with League of Legends helps all of us deepen our connection with the game and its universe. The store will hopefully provide players with another outlet to engage with League but with physical products.    

2.	**Why is the store launching as a beta?**
Launching in beta gives us the opportunity to interact with players faster as they experience an initial version of the store and the merch within. This will allow us to learn, adapt, and evolve in order to deliver a more comprehensive merch experience that players deserve. Initial feedback is critically important as we work to build the right catalogue and make the store an unforgettable experience.  

3.	**What can you expect out of the beta?**
Like any beta, the store will be a work in progress. The site is still under development, and while you can dive in and shop around right now, there are tons of things we plan to do in order to make the merch experience better. Expect to see real-time changes along the way as we evolve the site and product catalogue. 


Now that we covered a few items surrounding the beta, let’s talk about some of the merch that’ll be available and what the initial experience will be like when the Store Beta launches.

4.	**What product categories will be available during beta?**
We’ll have a variety of merch including clothing, collectibles, art, and accessories. Over time we’ll be explore new products within these categories and potentially even some spiffy new categories. 

5.	**Will all players have access to the same products?**
Making sure that at launch players can pick up the same merch is important to us, so we’re rolling out every region’s store with the same initial items 

6.	**What happens if an item sells out, will it be refreshed?** 
One of the major benefits of beta is that it helps us learn which items you really love. This ultimately helps us create merch that raises the bar on awesome. We can’t promise that every item will be available in unlimited amounts, but we’ll continue to bring in new merch as often as possible over the coming months.

7.	**If my region’s store sells out of an item can I buy the same item from another region?**
At this time, each website only delivers to a players dedicated geographical region. 


Right now we don’t have a concrete timeline for how long beta will last, but we’re going to remain in beta as it takes to build a merch store experience that hopefully gives League players around the world the experience they’ve been waiting for. We’ll continually make changes as the site grows, both in-store and behind the curtain, so keep an eye out as the experience evolves. 

We can’t wait to see what you think of the Riot Games Merch Store as we all take this first step in a journey towards leveling up League and Riot merch worldwide.

Here's a taste of some of the cool stuff you'll be able to get your hands on

replies.body: I can't wait for them to sell body pillows of champs.

Umm ... Hope you are not thinking the same as me ... Hope Not You sicko

how is that sick? don't be judgmental man. people can hump what they like. i'd get a jinx body pillow. =3

I'm really glad OCE (and every other region) will be getting their own merchandise store.

Usually as Australians we get left out on a lot of things and if we were ever to buy anything from overseas the shipping charges are hefty. Having an OCE merch store would probably mean the store is located domestically and shipping prices would be fair.

I also hope the price of merchandise is fair as well. Price discrimination tends to happen based on geographical segregation so I hope Riot doesn't do this us.

Hey Aegis, 

Keep in mind, all of that beautiful water around us makes shipping anything to Oceanic countries difficult. The cost of shipping will be $29 per delivery to anywhere in Australia or New Zealand. BUT, if you spend over $50 on merch you will save $19 on shipping, bringing the cost down to $10.

The discount will be applied automatically but won't be displayed in your cart until the very last stage of checkout. Check out the screen shot in the original post.

Hey guys, I just copy+pasted what I wrote in another post so yeah. Here is what I wrote:
(and here is the link: http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/Iv4FJvh5-ideas-for-the-league-of-legends-merchandise-store )

Hey guys, I contacted Riot Support for this and they suggested me to see how much 'attention' I would get from saying what I originally wanted to, but I decided to try start a thread of what us players would like to see in the League of Legends Merchandise Store which has been talked about on Surr@20.
So, the League of Legends Merchandise Store is quite self explanatory, a store of League of Legends Merchandise.

So, my original thought I handed to Riot Support was that Riot could try to 'make' Gunpla-like sets for the more mechanical themed skins such as:
Mecha Kha'Zix (or anything else in the Mecha Series)
Full Metal Jayce (or anything else in the Full Metal Series)
Battlecast Prime Cho'Gath (or anything else in the Battlecast Series)

So what is "Gunpla"?
Gunpla is basically the Japanese toy/model sets of Gundam robots from the anime Gundam. I honestly think having toy/model build-able sets like these in League of Legends would be absolutely amazing, since the models tend to be higher quality than just some immovable figurines which Riot are planning to sell anyway.

Anyway, I've attached a few pictures of what 'Gunpla' is in the links section and I honestly reckon that the most high priority skin goes to Mecha Kha'Zix. Just imagine a Mecha Kha'Zix model/toy in the 'fashion' of the Gunpla sets. Amazing.

http://cdn.hobbylink.tv/wp-content/uploads/2010/11/img_5497.jpg?d78934

http://otakurevolution.com/storyimgs/gunpla/HandPaintedMKII.jpg
Love the idea, have you tried to post it [here ](http://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/2oa0w0/merch_ideas/)as well? There is a BIG tread on Reddit full of creative ideas like yours!
xD yes i would buy rengar shirt

I've already spent $200... No regrets, my Christmas presents to myself.

Yo, Riot, the purchase went to Riot Hong Kong - can I ask where the items are being shipped from? HK or the US? Or somewhere else?

Hey Zeju,

our warehouse for Oceania is in Honk Kong.
I order couple of things on Monday and I got them on Friday. You can also check the tracking on the website to see where your items are.

Thanks

Well that just let me finish my Christmas shopping!
My friends can expect a Corki Hat and a Rammus Poro Plushie, and I picked myself up a Teemo hat finally!

Love it Riot!

Now if only you could bring more reasonable priced hoodies..... $96 is a big stretch for a lot of players.
Any real reason for the price of the hoodies other than the fact that people will buy them for that much? (I personally refuse as I find it completely ridiculous that it can be justified $96 for a hoodie...

Sorry it took me so much to find this info.
I spoke to the head of product for the merchandising and here his answer:

> May be tough to tell from pictures without these actually being in the wild, but using the Thresh hoodies as an example, we invested in everything from the fabric quality and weight (350gsm French terry) to finishes like the custom zipper pull and premium commercial grade glow ink that is the best in the market for brightness and duration. We wanted these hoodies to not only look and feel great, but also last a long time. We also understand the need to have multiple price points in the store across our categories and will be building out the assortment over time to reflect that goal. We’ll been adding items that are less expensive, as well as items that more expensive as we build out the store.

Also, just so you have an idea from someone who bought the hoodie, here a review found on reddit:
http://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/2op0ie/review_thresh_hoodie/

Hope this helps.

Awesome, Thanks Mirk!
I was completely unaware of the 'glow in the dark' aspect of the hoody. That's actually pretty neat.

My order is supposed to arrive today, so I am super keen for my Corki + Teemo hats + Poro's! Squeeeee

A few hoodies might be on the cards once a larger range is announced.

Thanks again for taking the time to answer!
My pleasure, did you receive it? Any feedback?
The rammus poro plush looks cute :)

I feel pretty disappointed that Riot decided to make their own (dodgy) figurines instead of licencing Funko to do it.

EDIT: Also, those prices are disgusting - even considering the currency strength difference between OCE and NA countries.

our dollar is better than America's at the moment though. or at least by comparison to when i was a kid. licensed merch has always been expensive, it comes with the territory. its like skins, no one is forcing you to buy it. if you dislike the quality or price. make your own. its the brand you are paying for, not the material. riot is a business. they do know how to...business.

It's not so much it being bad and me consequently not wanting to buy it. It's more to do with the fact that Riot now have their own mini figurines (which are, lets face it, pretty bad) meaning that there's little-to-no chance that Riot will license Funko to do Pop! Vinyls which means that Riot gets none of my money.

EDIT: Blizzard licenses Funko to manufacture and distribute figurines on their behalf.
